title: Varrock

properties.name: description
properties.value: Varrock (pronunciation: /və.ˈrɑk/ "vuh-ROCK") (originally known as Avarrocka and still known as such in barbarian speech) is the capital of the kingdom of Misthalin. It is one of the largest cities in Old School RuneScape and the largest city available to free players. It is also one of the most popular cities in all of RuneScape. The city is also known as Lemanto Andra ("Man City") in gnomic tongue.

Varrock (pronunciation: /və.ˈrɑk/ "vuh-ROCK") (originally known as Avarrocka and still known as such in barbarian speech) is the capital of the kingdom of Misthalin. It is one of the largest cities in Old School RuneScape and the largest city available to free players. It is also one of the most popular cities in all of RuneScape. The city is also known as Lemanto Andra ("Man City") in gnomic tongue.

The city of Avarrocka came into being in the year 700 of the Fourth Age, when the races that survived the God Wars began to compete for land without the direct aid of gods. At the time, the world was dangerous, and most of humanity lived in small nomadic tribes intent solely on surviving. One of these tribes, led by a small group of elders, was looking to settle in the forested territory that is now Misthalin. As they searched, they discovered a young boy, about two years of age, wandering near the River Lum, unable to remember his parents or speak. The boy was not ordinary, though, and stood nearly a foot taller than most his age. The wanderers, taking the boy's strength as a good omen, made a camp in the forest. It is said that, on that day, "both sun and moon were mingled in the sky."

Entrances[edit | edit source]

Varrock east entrance.

Varrock can be entered through the north gate from the Wilderness, through the east gate, through the south gate from Lumbridge, and through the west gate from Barbarian Village. Each entrance has level 21 guards surrounding it. Fortunately, the guards are not aggressive, meaning that if a low level player walks near them, the player will not be attacked, although players entering through the south entrance may be attacked by level 7 and 20 dark wizards. Members can enter Varrock from Edgeville Dungeon through the sewerage. Varrock's location in relation to the Wilderness makes it the best spot for low-level player killers.

Transportation[edit | edit source]

  • Players with 25 Magic can cast the Varrock Teleport Spell.
  • Balloon transport system - south of Lumber Yard, north-east of Varrock.
  • There is also a Spirit tree and a fairy ring just north-west of Varrock. DKR
  • The canoe transport system also has several landing points near Varrock, such as near the Champions' Guild and Edgeville.
  • Players can use a charged Combat bracelet or buy a Chronicle and Teleport cards from Diango's Toy Store to teleport to the Champions' Guild, south-west of the Varrock south gate.
  • Skills necklace - Can be used to teleport to the Cooks' Guild just west of Varrock
  • Ring of Wealth - Can be used to teleport to the Grand Exchange north-west of Varrock.

Banks[edit | edit source]

Varrock's banks are located near the east gate and near the west gate. They are very large buildings and are easy to spot. They are great places to buy and sell items as many players tend to congregate at these two banks.

East bank[edit | edit source]

Varrock east bank.

The east bank was once a very popular place to buy and sell items from other players before the introduction of the Grand Exchange. Some of the more common items that were sold here were rune essence and player killing goods such as food, lower levelled weapons and armour, runes, and potions.

The east bank also has a 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US]. This floor is much quieter than the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US], though holds nothing of value.

West bank[edit | edit source]

Varrock west bank.

This was the first, and once the only, bank in RuneScape. In its early days, this bank, then known as the "Bank of Varrock," could only hold coins in its accounts. In modern times, this is the most popular free-to-play bank. Many popular free-to-play items such as big bones, logs, and feathers were traded here before the Grand Exchange was available.

The west bank also has a 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] and a basement. There is nothing on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US], though it is much quieter than the ground floor[UK]1st floor[US]. The basement contains a south room with coins, one gold ore, one gold bar, a gold necklace, and a ruby ring behind a locked door. Players who have a Magic level of 33 or higher may use the Telekinetic Grab spell to obtain all the items except for the ruby ring. There is also a spawn of three coins on the floor to the north-east of the basement, directly in front of the stairs. The basement is a very popular place to have bank sales.

Stores[edit | edit source]

Varrock has many stores. Most of them are located in or around Varrock Square.

Varrock General Store[edit | edit source]

Varrock's general store is one of the most popular stores in the game. New players can buy a newcomer map, which can help them find their way around the free version of RuneScape.

Players can sell whatever they wish at the store, though mainly low level players sell their items, which are often not wanted by higher level players. It is also hard to sell items to this general store as many people sell their items here, causing the store's inventory limit to be reached very easily. Before the Grand Exchange, Varrock general store used to be a hub for trading, especially in F2P.

Varrock Swordshop[edit | edit source]

At the southern entrance is the Varrock Swordshop where players can buy swords. The store sells bronze, iron, steel, black, mithril and adamant daggers, swords and longswords.

Thessalia's Fine Clothes[edit | edit source]

Thessalia's Fine Clothes sell several types of clothes including robes, capes, gloves, and boots. Thessalia will also change a player's default clothing for a price of 500 coins. Players who were lucky enough to obtain a scythe when they were dropped, can retrieve it from this store if it is lost. Frog tokens from the frog random event can be exchanged for either a frog mask or a prince outfit at this shop.

Fancy Clothes Store[edit | edit source]

There is also Fancy Clothes Store in the south-eastern part of the city. It features heavily in the Hunter skill, and it is here that you have furs made into camouflage and other hunter armour.

Zaff's Superior Staffs![edit | edit source]

Near the centre of Varrock is Zaff's Superior Staffs, a store where players can purchase staves for Magic.

Zaff sells staffs, magic staffs, and elemental staves. He also sells battlestaves for use in the Crafting skill to players who have completed What Lies Below.

Horvik's Armour Shop[edit | edit source]

Horvik's Armour Shop is near the centre of Varrock. Here, players can buy platebodies and chainbodies as well as platelegs and some leather armour.

Aubury's Rune Shop[edit | edit source]

In the south-east corner of Varrock is Aubury's Rune Shop. Here, players can purchase most types of runes or be teleported to the Rune Essence mine. Players must come here and speak to Aubury twice during the Rune Mysteries Quest.

Lowe's Archery Emporium[edit | edit source]

To the east of Varrock General Store is Lowe's Archery Emporium, a store which sells items designed for players who use the Ranging skill.

Lowe sells many types of bows and crossbows, as well as their corresponding ammunition.

Trees[edit | edit source]

Varrock has many trees in and around it. Inside the city are four yew trees. To the south of the city are some willow trees and some oak trees. To the east of the city are some more yew trees. There is also a tree patch in Varrock Castle courtyard, allowing players to grow their own trees with the Farming skill.

Altars[edit | edit source]

Varrock has a total of three altars within its walls.

Altars of Saradomin[edit | edit source]

  • The Varrock Palace altar - Located on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US], toward the rear of the palace.
  • Varrock Chapel - Located in the north-east corner of the city and presided over by Father Lawrence.

Altars of Zamorak[edit | edit source]

  • Altar of Chaos - Located south of Wizard Aubury's rune store in the south-east corner of the city. You can talk to a Zamorak Mage here after completing his miniquest, Enter the Abyss.

Pubs[edit | edit source]

Varrock and the surrounding area has four pubs. Most Varrockian pubs sell only beer, but the Rat Pit Bar also sells stew.

The Blue Moon Inn[edit | edit source]

The Blue Moon Inn is by far the most popular pub in Varrock. One-Eyed Hector the Pirate once stayed here. You can find a couple NPCs here besides the bartender, which include an unnamed Barbarian warrior woman, the ex-vampyre slayer master Dr. Harlow, a tramp in the back room of the store, and the fat Johnny the Beard (who drops the Varrock Herald, used for Shield of Arrav).

The Dancing Donkey Inn[edit | edit source]

The Dancing Donkey Inn is unknown to most of Varrock because it is in the corner of the city that contains little of significance. While there, you may stumble upon the three drunken NPCs here: Hops, too drunken to speak, Da Vinci, who hates free players, and Chancy, who loves to gamble.

The Jolly Boar Inn[edit | edit source]

The Jolly Boar Inn is actually outside the Varrock city walls, but is still considered a Varrockian pub because it is within the vicinity. The very tired Johnathon (involved in the Family Crest quest) can be found here. There are a lot of other NPCs here, including one woman, two men, and a Black Knight.

Rat Pit Bar[edit | edit source]

This very little known pub can be found down the manhole in south-east Varrock, in the area that is cordoned off. It is very small and is mostly occupied with gamblers taking a break from the Rat Pits mini-game.

Guilds[edit | edit source]

Both of these are just outside of Varrock:

  • Cooks' Guild to the west
  • Champions' Guild to the south

Dungeons[edit | edit source]

  • Varrock Sewers
  • Tunnel of Chaos
  • Champions' Guild Basement
  • Saradomin Shrine
  • Digsite Dungeon
  • Rat Pits
  • Dungeon of Tolna

Other interesting buildings[edit | edit source]

Paterdomus[edit | edit source]

Main article: Paterdomus

Digsite[edit | edit source]

Main article: Digsite

The Digsite is an archaeological excavation area just east of Varrock. Players need to proceed far enough into The Dig Site quest in order to fully use it. It is visited during several quests:

  • The Dig Site
  • The Golem
  • Desert Treasure
  • A Soul's Bane
  • Elemental Workshop II

Varrock Palace[edit | edit source]

The Varrock Palace is the focus of many quests. It has a library, different floors and other things. Inside there is a trapped Monk of Zamorak in a cage. The Queen and King Roald reside here. Garden of Tranquillity is the most notable quest. Inside also resides a few warrior women. The palace also contains the Library of Varrock, which is filled with books explaining the history of RuneScape. The Varrock Square is directly in front of the palace.

In the Demon Slayer quest, there is a drain on the north-east part of the palace. Inside, there is a key to retrieve. To get it, you must pour water down the drain by getting a bucket (there is one conveniently located near the stairs that leads into the kitchen on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US]), filling the bucket with water, and pouring the water down the drain. The key will then slosh down to the Varrock Sewers, which is on the east side of the palace.

Varrock Museum[edit | edit source]

Like the palace, it plays a part in quests such as Shield of Arrav, The Golem, The Dig Site and Desert Treasure.

Natural History Quiz[edit | edit source]

Main article: Natural history quiz

The natural history quiz is the basement section of the Varrock Museum miniquest. It consists of 14 creature displays in which the player must answer three questions correctly in order to earn two kudos each for a total of 28.

Each of the rooms has a natural historian, who will give a lecture about each creature for which the quiz is based on.

To start the quiz, speak to Orlando Smith in the centre of the room. Click on the plaque in front of a display to get a question. After answering three questions correctly, the quiz questions are replaced by the common name and scientific name of the animal.

Once all questions are complete, speak to Orlando again to receive 1,000 experience in both Hunter and Slayer. Note: If this is the first Slayer experience you have received, you won't receive a free enchanted gem from the Slayer masters during your first assignment and will need to pay 1 coin to buy one.

Stone circle[edit | edit source]

The stone circle south of Varrock plays a big part in Demon Slayer. This is where Delrith is summoned, and where he is defeated by the player.

The stone circle has many level 20 and level 7 dark wizards and is very popular for players, especially rangers, to train at because of the runes they may drop. It is also because of these wizards that made it notorious for new players to be killed, thus inviting a lot of high level scavenging players to take what was dropped by the dead players.

Quests[edit | edit source]

Many quests can be started in or around Varrock. These quests are listed below:

Free-to-play quests[edit | edit source]

  • Demon Slayer is started by speaking to the gypsy who is in her tent, at Varrock's central square.
  • Dragon Slayer I may be started by speaking to the Guildmaster of the Champions' Guild to the south of Varrock.
  • Romeo & Juliet is started by speaking to Romeo, who is found around Varrock's central square.
  • Shield of Arrav may be started by speaking to Reldo in the palace library.

Members quests[edit | edit source]

  • A Soul's Bane may be started by speaking to Launa at the "Rift" entrance, north-west of the Dig Site.
  • Family Crest is started by speaking to Dimintheis, in the south-eastern corner of Varrock.
  • Gertrude's Cat is started by speaking to Gertrude, who resides in her house along the path that leads to Barbarian Village.
  • Garden of Tranquillity is started by speaking to Her Royal Highness, Queen Ellamaria, in the palace garden.
  • Priest in Peril is started by speaking to King Roald in the palace.
  • Ratcatchers may be started by speaking to Gertrude while you have a cat or kitten.
  • What Lies Below is started by speaking to Rat Burgiss, who is found along the halfway along the road between Varrock's southern entrance, and Lumbridge.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Rats (level 1)
  • Men and Women (level 2)
  • Mugger (level 6)
  • Barbarian woman (level 9)
  • Thieves (level 16)
  • Guards (level 22)
  • Outlaws (level 32)
  • Black Knights (level 33)
  • Lucien (level 14, only fought during Temple of Ikov)
  • Giant rat (level 3 or 6)
  • Bear

Miscellaneous[edit | edit source]

Players may find many amenities available to them throughout Varrock.

Anvils[edit | edit source]

Anvils are located south of the west bank, north-west of the east bank in Horvik's Armour Shop, and south of the east bank.

Ranges[edit | edit source]

Ranges are located in small houses all over Varrock. They are easy to spot. The best one for cooking, which is nearest to a bank is the one to the south-west of the east bank.

Water sources[edit | edit source]

Players can obtain water from sinks in the castle and in fountains outside the castle and near the east bank.

Combat training[edit | edit source]

Low level players can raise their combat level by hitting dummies north of the east bank and on in the castle.

Baraek[edit | edit source]

Baraek is an NPC in Varrock's centre who buys and sells fur. He can be used to complete the quest Shield of Arrav.

Apothecary[edit | edit source]

The Apothecary is south of the west bank. He can make strength potions provided that players bring him 5 coins, one limpwurt root, and some red spiders' eggs. The Apothecary can also make energy potions with 1 chocolate dust and 2 limpwurt roots.

Master farmer[edit | edit source]

South of Varrock is a master farmer who can be thieved for seeds.

Varrock Library[edit | edit source]

On one of the bookcases in the palace there is a book named "Conan the Librarian", paying homage to the movie UHF.

Benny[edit | edit source]

Benny sells the Varrock Herald, the newspaper of Varrock, for 50 coins.

There is a leather body spawn place near the magic store (in house with two logs spawning too).

Music[edit | edit source]

Inside walls[edit | edit source]

  • Adventure
  • Garden
  • Looking Back (Varrock Museum)
  • Medieval
  • Spirit

Outside walls[edit | edit source]

  • Doorways
  • Expanse
  • Greatness
  • Still Night

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
3 September 2015
(update)

The roof of Horvik's Armour Shop no longer turns transparent when in the upstairs of the bank nearby.

26 February 2015
(update | poll)

The Grand Exchange is now located north-west of Varrock, west of Varrock Palace.

22 January 2015
(update | poll)

The north side of Varrock west bank has now been opened up to allow easier access to the nearby agility shortcut.

6 February 2014
(update)

A stray anvil map icon has been removed from the palace wall near Varrock's western bank.

30 January 2014
(update | poll)

A shortcut has been added north of Varrock west bank, allowing easier access to the spirit tree.

29 May 2007
(update)

Varrock was graphically updated. (This update created the modern look of Varrock.)

It is one of the largest cities in ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'' and the largest city available to [[free player]]s. It is also one of the most popular cities in all of ''RuneScape''. The city is also known as Lemanto Andra ("Man City") in [[Gnome|gnomic]] tongue. The city of Avarrocka came into being in the year 700 of the [[Fourth Age]], when the races that survived the [[God Wars]] began to compete for land without the direct aid of [[gods]]. At the time, the world was dangerous, and most of humanity lived in small nomadic tribes intent solely on surviving. One of these tribes, led by a small group of elders, was looking to settle in the forested territory that is now [[Misthalin]]. As they searched, they discovered a young boy, about two years of age, wandering near the [[River Lum]], unable to remember his parents or speak. The boy was not ordinary, though, and stood nearly a foot taller than most his age. The wanderers, taking the boy's strength as a good omen, made a camp in the forest. It is said that, on that day, "both sun and moon were mingled in the sky." ==Entrances== [[File:Varrock east entrance.png|thumb|Varrock east entrance.]] Varrock can be entered through the north gate from the [[Wilderness]], through the east gate, through the south gate from [[Lumbridge]], and through the west gate from [[Barbarian Village]]. Each entrance has level 21 [[guard]]s surrounding it. Fortunately, the guards are not [[aggressive]], meaning that if a low level player walks near them, the player will not be attacked, although players entering through the south entrance may be attacked by level 7 and 20 [[dark wizard]]s. [[Members]] can enter Varrock from [[Edgeville Dungeon]] through the [[Varrock Sewers|sewerage]]. Varrock's location in relation to the Wilderness makes it the best spot for low-level [[player killer]]s. ==Transportation== *Players with 25 [[Magic]] can cast the [[Varrock Teleport]] Spell. *[[Balloon transport system]] - south of [[Lumber Yard]], north-east of Varrock. *There is also a [[Spirit tree]] and a [[fairy ring]] just north-west of Varrock. {{fairycode|DKR}} *The [[canoe]] transport system also has several landing points near Varrock, such as near the [[Champions' Guild]] and [[Edgeville]]. *Players can use a charged [[Combat bracelet]] or buy a [[Chronicle]] and [[Teleport card]]s from [[Diango's Toy Store]] to teleport to the [[Champions' Guild]], south-west of the Varrock south gate. *[[Skills necklace]] - Can be used to teleport to the [[Cooks' Guild]] just west of Varrock *[[Ring of Wealth]] - Can be used to teleport to the [[Grand Exchange]] north-west of Varrock. ==Banks== Varrock's banks are located near the east gate and near the west gate. They are very large buildings and are easy to spot. They are great places to buy and sell items as many players tend to congregate at these two banks. ===East bank=== [[File:Varrock East bank.png|thumb|Varrock east bank.]] The east bank was once a very popular place to buy and sell items from other players before the introduction of the [[Grand Exchange]]. Some of the more common items that were sold here were [[rune essence]] and [[player killing]] goods such as food, lower levelled [[weapons]] and [[armour]], [[runes]], and [[potions]]. The east bank also has a {{FloorNumber|uk=1}}. This floor is much quieter than the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}}, though holds nothing of value. ===West bank=== [[File:Varrock West bank.png|thumb|Varrock west bank.]] This was the first, and once the only, bank in ''RuneScape''. In its early days, this bank, then known as the "Bank of Varrock," could only hold [[coins]] in its accounts. In modern times, this is the most popular [[free-to-play]] bank. Many popular free-to-play items such as [[big bones]], [[logs]], and [[feathers]] were traded here before the Grand Exchange was available. The west bank also has a {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} and a basement. There is nothing on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}}, though it is much quieter than the {{FloorNumber|uk=0}}. The basement contains a south room with [[coins]], one [[gold ore]], one [[gold bar]], a [[gold necklace]], and a [[ruby ring]] behind a locked door. Players who have a [[Magic]] level of 33 or higher may use the [[Telekinetic Grab]] spell to obtain all the items except for the [[ruby ring]]. There is also a spawn of three [[coin]]s on the floor to the north-east of the basement, directly in front of the stairs. The basement is a very popular place to have bank sales. ==Stores== Varrock has many stores. Most of them are located in or around [[Varrock Square]]. ===Varrock General Store=== Varrock's [[general store]] is one of the most popular stores in the game. New players can buy a [[newcomer map]], which can help them find their way around the [[Free-to-play|free version]] of ''[[RuneScape]]''. Players can sell whatever they wish at the store, though mainly low level players sell their items, which are often not wanted by higher level players. It is also hard to sell items to this general store as many people sell their items here, causing the store's inventory limit to be reached very easily. Before the Grand Exchange, Varrock general store used to be a hub for trading, especially in F2P. ===Varrock Swordshop=== At the southern entrance is the [[Varrock Swordshop]] where players can buy [[sword]]s. The store sells [[bronze dagger|bronze]], [[iron dagger|iron]], [[steel dagger|steel]], [[black dagger|black]], [[mithril dagger|mithril]] and [[adamant dagger|adamant]] [[dagger]]s, [[sword]]s and [[longsword]]s. ===Thessalia's Fine Clothes=== [[Thessalia's Fine Clothes]] sell several types of clothes including [[robes]], [[cape]]s, [[gloves]], and [[boots]]. [[Thessalia]] will also change a player's default clothing for a price of 500 coins. Players who were lucky enough to obtain a [[scythe]] when they were dropped, can retrieve it from this store if it is lost. [[Frog token]]s from the [[frog]] random event can be exchanged for either a [[frog mask]] or a [[prince outfit]] at this shop. ===Fancy Clothes Store=== There is also [[Fancy Clothes Store]] in the south-eastern part of the city. It features heavily in the [[Hunter]] skill, and it is here that you have furs made into camouflage and other [[hunter armour]]. ===Zaff's Superior Staffs!=== Near the centre of Varrock is [[Zaff's Superior Staffs]], a store where players can purchase staves for [[Magic]]. Zaff sells [[staff]]s, [[magic staff]]s, and elemental [[staves]]. He also sells [[battlestaves]] for use in the [[Crafting]] skill to players who have completed [[What Lies Below]]. ===Horvik's Armour Shop=== [[Horvik's Armour Shop]] is near the centre of Varrock. Here, players can buy [[platebodies]] and [[chainbodies]] as well as [[platelegs]] and some [[leather armour]]. ===Aubury's Rune Shop=== In the south-east corner of Varrock is [[Aubury's Rune Shop]]. Here, players can purchase most types of [[runes]] or be teleported to the [[Rune Essence mine]]. Players must come here and speak to [[Aubury]] twice during the [[Rune Mysteries]] Quest. ===Lowe's Archery Emporium=== To the east of Varrock General Store is [[Lowe's Archery Emporium]], a store which sells items designed for players who use the [[Ranging]] skill. [[Lowe]] sells many types of [[bow]]s and [[crossbow (weapon)|crossbows]], as well as their corresponding [[ammunition]]. ==Trees== Varrock has many [[tree]]s in and around it. Inside the city are four [[yew]] trees. To the south of the city are some [[willow]] trees and some [[oak]] trees. To the east of the city are some more yew trees. There is also a [[tree patch]] in Varrock Castle courtyard, allowing players to grow their own trees with the [[Farming]] skill. ==Altars== Varrock has a total of three [[altar]]s within its walls. ===Altars of Saradomin=== *The [[Varrock Palace]] [[altar]] - Located on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}}, toward the rear of the palace. *Varrock Chapel - Located in the north-east corner of the city and presided over by [[Father Lawrence]]. ===Altars of Zamorak=== *Altar of Chaos - Located south of [[Aubury's Rune Shop|Wizard Aubury's rune store]] in the south-east corner of the city. You can talk to a [[Mage of Zamorak|Zamorak Mage]] here after completing his [[miniquest]], [[Enter the Abyss]]. ==Pubs== Varrock and the surrounding area has four pubs. Most Varrockian pubs sell only beer, but the Rat Pit Bar also sells stew. ===The Blue Moon Inn=== The [[Blue Moon Inn]] is by far the most popular pub in Varrock. One-Eyed Hector the Pirate once stayed here. You can find a couple NPCs here besides the bartender, which include an unnamed Barbarian warrior woman, the ex-vampyre slayer master [[Dr. Harlow]], a tramp in the back room of the store, and the fat [[Johnny the Beard]] (who drops the Varrock Herald, used for [[Shield of Arrav]]). ===The Dancing Donkey Inn=== The [[Dancing Donkey Inn]] is unknown to most of Varrock because it is in the corner of the city that contains little of significance. While there, you may stumble upon the three drunken NPCs here: [[Hops (Biohazard)|Hops]], too drunken to speak, [[Da Vinci]], who hates [[free player]]s, and [[Chancy]], who loves to gamble. ===The Jolly Boar Inn=== The [[Jolly Boar Inn]] is actually outside the Varrock city walls, but is still considered a Varrockian pub because it is within the vicinity. The very tired [[Johnathon]] (involved in the [[Family Crest]] quest) can be found here. There are a lot of other NPCs here, including one woman, two men, and a [[Black Knight]]. ===Rat Pit Bar=== This very little known pub can be found down the manhole in south-east Varrock, in the area that is cordoned off. It is very small and is mostly occupied with gamblers taking a break from the [[Rat Pits]] mini-game. ==Guilds== Both of these are just outside of Varrock: *[[Cooks' Guild]] to the west *[[Champions' Guild]] to the south ==Dungeons== *[[Varrock Sewers]] *[[Tunnel of Chaos]] *[[Champion's Challenge|Champions' Guild Basement]] *[[Saradomin Shrine]] *[[Digsite Dungeon]] *[[Rat Pits]] *[[Dungeon of Tolna]] ==Other interesting buildings== ===Paterdomus=== {{Main|Paterdomus}} ===Digsite=== {{Main|Digsite}} The [[Digsite]] is an archaeological excavation area just east of Varrock. Players need to proceed far enough into [[The Dig Site]] quest in order to fully use it. It is visited during several quests: *[[The Dig Site]] *[[The Golem]] *[[Desert Treasure]] *[[A Soul's Bane]] *[[Elemental Workshop II]] ===Varrock Palace=== The [[Varrock Palace]] is the focus of many quests. It has a library, different floors and other things. Inside there is a trapped [[Monk of Zamorak]] in a cage. The Queen and [[King Roald]] reside here. [[Garden of Tranquillity]] is the most notable quest. Inside also resides a few [[Warrior woman|warrior women]]. The palace also contains the Library of Varrock, which is filled with books explaining the history of ''RuneScape''. The [[Varrock Square]] is directly in front of the palace. In the [[Demon Slayer]] quest, there is a drain on the north-east part of the palace. Inside, there is a key to retrieve. To get it, you must pour water down the drain by getting a [[bucket]] (there is one conveniently located near the stairs that leads into the kitchen on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}}), filling the bucket with water, and pouring the water down the drain. The key will then slosh down to the [[Varrock Sewers]], which is on the east side of the palace. ===Varrock Museum=== Like the [[Varrock Palace|palace]], it plays a part in quests such as [[Shield of Arrav]], [[The Golem]], [[The Dig Site]] and [[Desert Treasure]]. ====Natural History Quiz==== {{Main|Natural history quiz}} The [[natural history quiz]] is the basement section of the [[Varrock Museum]] [[miniquest]]. It consists of 14 creature displays in which the player must answer three questions correctly in order to earn two [[kudos]] each for a total of 28. Each of the rooms has a natural historian, who will give a lecture about each creature for which the quiz is based on. To start the quiz, speak to [[Orlando Smith]] in the centre of the room. Click on the plaque in front of a display to get a question. After answering three questions correctly, the quiz questions are replaced by the common name and scientific name of the animal. Once all questions are complete, speak to Orlando again to receive 1,000 [[experience]] in both [[Hunter]] and [[Slayer]]. '''Note:''' If this is the first Slayer experience you have received, you won't receive a free [[enchanted gem]] from the [[Slayer master]]s during your first assignment and will need to pay 1 coin to buy one. ===Stone circle=== The [[stone circle]] south of Varrock plays a big part in [[Demon Slayer]]. This is where [[Delrith]] is summoned, and where he is defeated by the player. The stone circle has many level 20 and level 7 [[dark wizard]]s and is very popular for players, especially [[Ranged|rangers]], to train at because of the [[runes]] they may drop. It is also because of these wizards that made it notorious for new players to be killed, thus inviting a lot of high level scavenging players to take what was dropped by the dead players. ==Quests== Many [[quests]] can be started in or around Varrock. These quests are listed below: ===Free-to-play quests=== *[[Demon Slayer]] is started by speaking to the [[Gypsy Aris|gypsy]] who is in her tent, at Varrock's [[Varrock Square|central square]]. *[[Dragon Slayer I]] may be started by speaking to the [[Guildmaster]] of the [[Champions' Guild]] to the south of Varrock. *[[Romeo & Juliet]] is started by speaking to [[Romeo]], who is found around Varrock's central square. *[[Shield of Arrav]] may be started by speaking to [[Reldo]] in the palace library. ===Members quests=== *[[A Soul's Bane]] may be started by speaking to [[Launa]] at the "Rift" entrance, north-west of the Dig Site. *[[Family Crest]] is started by speaking to [[Dimintheis]], in the south-eastern corner of Varrock. *[[Gertrude's Cat]] is started by speaking to [[Gertrude]], who resides in her house along the path that leads to [[Barbarian Village]]. *[[Garden of Tranquillity]] is started by speaking to Her Royal Highness, Queen [[Ellamaria]], in the [[Varrock Palace|palace]] garden. *[[Priest in Peril]] is started by speaking to [[King Roald]] in the palace. *[[Ratcatchers]] may be started by speaking to Gertrude while you have a cat or kitten. *[[What Lies Below]] is started by speaking to [[Rat Burgiss]], who is found along the halfway along the road between Varrock's southern entrance, and [[Lumbridge]]. ==Monsters== *[[Rat]]s (level 1) *[[Man|Men]] and [[Woman|Women]] (level 2) *[[Mugger]] (level 6) *[[Barbarian]] woman (level 9) *[[Thief|Thieves]] (level 16) *[[Guard]]s (level 22) *[[Outlaw]]s (level 32) *[[Black Knight]]s (level 33) *[[Lucien]] (level 14, only fought during [[Temple of Ikov]]) *[[Giant rat]] (level 3 or 6) *Bear ==Miscellaneous== Players may find many amenities available to them throughout Varrock. ===Anvils=== [[Anvil]]s are located south of the west bank, north-west of the east bank in [[Horvik's Armour Shop]], and south of the east bank. ===Ranges=== [[Range]]s are located in small houses all over Varrock. They are easy to spot. The best one for [[cooking]], which is nearest to a bank is the one to the south-west of the east bank. ===Water sources=== Players can obtain water from sinks in the [[Varrock Palace|castle]] and in fountains outside the castle and near the east bank. ===Combat training=== Low level players can raise their combat level by hitting [[Dummy|dummies]] north of the east bank and on in the castle. ===Baraek=== [[Baraek]] is an NPC in Varrock's centre who buys and sells fur. He can be used to complete the quest [[Shield of Arrav]]. ===Apothecary=== The [[Apothecary]] is south of the west bank. He can make [[strength potion]]s provided that players bring him 5 coins, one [[limpwurt root]], and some [[red spiders' eggs]]. The Apothecary can also make [[energy potion]]s with 1 [[chocolate dust]] and 2 limpwurt roots. ===Master farmer=== South of Varrock is a [[master farmer]] who can be thieved for seeds. ===Varrock Library=== On one of the bookcases in the palace there is a book named "Conan the Librarian", paying homage to the movie UHF. ===Benny=== [[Benny]] sells the [[Varrock Herald]], the [[newspaper]] of Varrock, for 50 coins. There is a [[leather body]] spawn place near the magic store (in house with two logs spawning too). ==Music== ===Inside walls=== *[[Adventure]] *[[Garden (music track)|Garden]] *[[Looking Back]] ([[Varrock Museum]]) *[[Medieval]] *[[Spirit (music track)|Spirit]] ===Outside walls=== *[[Doorways]] *[[Expanse]] *[[Greatness]] *[[Still Night]] ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 3 September 2015 |update = Barrows Features & Saradomin's Light |change = The roof of [[Horvik's Armour Shop]] no longer turns transparent when in the upstairs of the bank nearby. }} {{Subject changes |date = 26 February 2015 |update = The Grand Exchange |poll = Old School Content Poll 29: Grand Exchange |change = The [[Grand Exchange]] is now located north-west of Varrock, west of [[Varrock Palace]]. }} {{Subject changes |date = 22 January 2015 |update = Zulrah, Bank Space & More |poll = Old School Content Poll 29: Grand Exchange |change = The north side of Varrock west bank has now been opened up to allow easier access to the nearby agility shortcut. }} {{Subject changes |date = 6 February 2014 |update = Quick-prayers & Loot Broadcast |change = A stray anvil map icon has been removed from the palace wall near Varrock's western bank. }} {{Subject changes |date = 30 January 2014 |update = Release the Kraken! |poll = Old School feature poll 15: Rejuvenating the Wilderness |change = A [[Shortcuts|shortcut]] has been added north of Varrock west bank, allowing easier access to the [[spirit tree]]. }} {{Subject changes |date = 29 May 2007 |update = Varrock's New Look |poll = |change = Varrock was graphically updated. (This update created the modern look of Varrock.) }} {{Subject changes footer}} {{The Legend of Arrav}} {{Varrock}}
